verses.plain: Bel boweth down, Nebo stoopeth, their idols were upon the beasts, and upon the cattle: your carriages were heavy loaden; they are a burden to the weary beast.

tokens.t: Bel boweth down, Nebo stoopeth, their idols were upon the beasts, and upon the cattle: your carriages
heavy loaden;
a burden to the weary

verses.plain: They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden, but themselves are gone into captivity.

tokens.t: They stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliver the burden, but themselves are gone into captivity.

verses.plain: ¶ Hearken unto me, O house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, which are borne by me from the belly, which are carried from the womb:

tokens.t: ¶ Hearken unto me, O house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, which are borne
from the belly, which are carried from the womb:

verses.plain: And even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you: I have made, and I will bear; even I will carry, and will deliver you.

tokens.t: And
to
old age I
he; and
to hoar hairs will I carry
I have made, and I will bear; even I will carry, and will deliver

verses.plain: ¶ To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal, and compare me, that we may be like?

tokens.t: ¶ To whom will ye liken me, and make
equal, and compare me, that we may be like?

verses.plain: They lavish gold out of the bag, and weigh silver in the balance, and hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god: they fall down, yea, they worship.

tokens.t: They lavish gold out of the bag, and weigh silver in the balance,
hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god: they fall down, yea, they worship.

verses.plain: They bear him upon the shoulder, they carry him, and set him in his place, and he standeth; from his place shall he not remove: yea, one shall cry unto him, yet can he not answer, nor save him out of his trouble.

tokens.t: They bear him upon the shoulder, they carry him, and set him in his place, and he standeth; from his place shall he not remove: yea,
shall cry unto him, yet can he not answer, nor save him out of his trouble.

verses.plain: Remember this, and shew yourselves men: bring it again to mind, O ye transgressors.

tokens.t: Remember this, and shew yourselves men: bring
again to mind, O ye transgressors.

verses.plain: Remember the former things of old: for I am God, and there is none else; I am God, and there is none like me,

tokens.t: Remember the former things of old: for I
God, and
none else;
God, and
none like me,

verses.plain: Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times the things that are not yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:

tokens.t: Declaring the end from the beginning, and from ancient times
that are not
done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my pleasure:

verses.plain: Calling a ravenous bird from the east, the man that executeth my counsel from a far country: yea, I have spoken it, I will also bring it to pass; I have purposed it, I will also do it.

tokens.t: Calling a ravenous bird from the east, the man that executeth my counsel from a far country: yea, I have spoken
, I will also bring it to pass; I have purposed
, I will also do it.

verses.plain: ¶ Hearken unto me, ye stouthearted, that are far from righteousness:

tokens.t: ¶ Hearken unto me, ye stouthearted, that
far from righteousness:

verses.plain: I bring near my righteousness; it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not tarry: and I will place salvation in Zion for Israel my glory.

tokens.t: I bring near my righteousness; it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not tarry: and I will place salvation in Zion for Israel my glory.
